00002  *
00003  *  Routines to perform Bulirsch-Stoer step.

00014 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00015 
00016 
00017 void Lgm_ModMid( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, double H, int n, double sgn, 
00018          int (*Mag)(Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_MagModelInfo *), Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00019 
00020     int         m;
00021     double      h2, h;
00022     Lgm_Vector  z0, z1, z2, B;
00023 
00024 
00025     /*
00026      *  Set stepsize, h and 2*h.
00027      */
00028     h  = sgn * H/(double)n;
00029     h2 = 2.0 * h;
00030 
00031 
00032     /*
00033      *  Set initial point, z0.
00034      */
00035     z0 = *u;
00036 
00037 
00038     /*
00039      *  Do initial Euler step to get z1.
00040      */
00041     (*Mag)(&z0, &B, Info); Lgm_NormalizeVector(&B);
00042     z1.x = z0.x + h*B.x; 
00043     z1.y = z0.y + h*B.y; 
00044     z1.z = z0.z + h*B.z;
00045     
00046 
00047     /*
00048      *  Do general step to get z2 -> zn. This is midpoint formula.
00049      */
00050     for ( m = 1; m < n; ++m ) {
00051 
00052         (*Mag)(&z1, &B, Info); Lgm_NormalizeVector(&B);
00053         z2.x = z0.x + h2*B.x; 
00054         z2.y = z0.y + h2*B.y; 
00055         z2.z = z0.z + h2*B.z;
00056     z0 = z1;
00057     z1 = z2;
00058 
00059     }
00060 
00061 
00062     /*
00063      *  Do final Euler step to get z(n+1).
00064      */
00065     (*Mag)(&z1, &B, Info); Lgm_NormalizeVector(&B);
00066     z2.x = z1.x + h*B.x; 
00067     z2.y = z1.y + h*B.y; 
00068     z2.z = z1.z + h*B.z;
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072     /*
00073      *   The final answer for zn is the average of z(n-1) and z(n+1). 
00074      */
00075     v->x = 0.5 * (z0.x + z2.x); 
00076     v->y = 0.5 * (z0.y + z2.y); 
00077     v->z = 0.5 * (z0.z + z2.z);
00078     
00079 
00080 
00081 }
00082 
00083 
00084 // NOT thread safe?
00085 void Lgm_RatFunExt( int k, double x_k, Lgm_Vector *u_k, Lgm_Vector *w, Lgm_Vector *dw, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00086 
00087     int             i, j;
00088     double          yy, v, ddy=0.0, c, b1, b, fx[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX];
00089     double          y_k[3], y[3], dy[3];
00090 //    static double   d[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX][LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX], x[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX];
00091 
00092     /*
00093      *  (x_k, y_k) is the kth "data point" in the sequence.
00094      */
00095     y_k[0] = u_k->x; y_k[1] = u_k->y; y_k[2] = u_k->z;
00096 
00097     Info->Lgm_MagStep_x[k] = x_k;
00098     if (k == 0) {
00099     for (i=0; i<3; ++i) y[i] = dy[i] = Info->Lgm_MagStep_d[i][0] = y_k[i];
00100     } else {
00101     for (j=0; j<k; ++j) fx[j+1] = Info->Lgm_MagStep_x[k-j-1] / x_k;
00102     for (i=0; i<3; ++i) {
00103         v = Info->Lgm_MagStep_d[i][0];
00104         c = yy = Info->Lgm_MagStep_d[i][0] = y_k[i];
00105         for (j=1; j<=k; ++j) {
00106         b1 = fx[j] * v;
00107         b  = b1 - c;
00108         if (b != 0.0) {
00109             b    = (c - v)/b;
00110             ddy  = c * b;
00111             c    = b1 * b;
00112         } else{
00113             ddy = v;
00114         }
00115         if (j != k) v = Info->Lgm_MagStep_d[i][j];
00116         Info->Lgm_MagStep_d[i][j]  = ddy;
00117         yy      += ddy;
00118         }
00119         dy[i] = ddy;
00120         y[i]  = yy;
00121     }
00122     }
00123 
00124     /*
00125      *  (x_k, u_k) are the input "data points". The rational function should go through
00126      *  all of these points. w is the rational function evaluated at x_k = 0.0 -- i.e.
00127      *  an estimate of what the sequence of modified midpoint estimates would converge to
00128      *  for infinitely small step sizes. dw is the error in this estimate.
00129      *
00130      */
00131     w->x  = y[0];    w->y  = y[1];    w->z  = y[2];
00132     dw->x = dy[0];   dw->y = dy[1];   dw->z = dy[2];
00133 }
00134 
00135 
00136 
00137 
00138 /*
00139  *
00140  *
00141  *  This routine is basically the one in Num. Rec.  The bulk of the code here is
00142  *  trying to figure out what the optimal value should be for the next step.  It
00143  *  uses a method developed by Deuflhard, 1985 based on information theory.
00144  *  However, Shampine, 1987 points out that a much simpler heuristic often does
00145  *  alot better. The problem with Deuflhard's method is apparently twofold: first
00146  *  Shampine claims that the information theory is not (necessarily) valid for any
00147  *  given problem (and when it comes down to it we really do have only one problem
00148  *  to solve). And second, even if it was applicable, Shampine claims that it is
00149  *  "the answer" to the wrong question -- i.e. it doesnt address the real
00150  *  problem.  Well....  We'll stick with this one for a while, but Shampine's
00151  *  approach sounds better, and the stats he shows indicate that significantly
00152  *  fewer function evals are needed...
00153  *
00154  *
00155  */
00156 // NOT thread safe?
00157 int Lgm_MagStep( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *u_scale, 
00158           double Htry, double *Hdid, double *Hnext, 
00159           double eps, double sgn, double *s, int *reset,
00160           int (*Mag)(Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_MagModelInfo *), Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ){
00161 
00162 
00163     Lgm_Vector      u_save, v, uerr, e;
00164     int             q, k, kk, km=0, n;
00165     int             reduction, done;
00166     double          h2, sss, n2, f, H, err[LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX+1];
00167     double          eps1, max_error=0.0, fact, red=1.0, scale=1.0, work, workmin;
00168 //static int        Info->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough=TRUE, Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax, Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt;
00169 //static double   Info->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old=-1.0, Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew;
00170 //static double   A[JMAX+1], Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[IMAX+1][IMAX+1];
00171     /*
00172      *  This sequence seems to be pretty good in general. The "1" seems to be
00173      *  really essential to speed things up (on some test runsa, its almost a factor of
00174      *  (2 slower without it!).
00175      */
00176     static int  Seq[] = { 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, 24, 32, 48, 64 };
00177 
00178 
00179 
00180     if ( ( eps != Info->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old ) || ( *reset ) ){
00181 
00182         *Hnext  = -1.0;
00183         eps1    = LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE1*eps;
00184         Info->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old = eps;
00185 
00186         /*
00187          *  Compute work to get to column k of the tableau.
00188          *  Here we assume work is just the number of function
00189          *  evals needed to get to column k.
00190          */
00191         Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[1] = Seq[1] + 1;
00192         for (k=1; k <= LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX; ++k) Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[k+1] = Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[k] + Seq[k+1];
00193 
00194 
00195         /*
00196          *  Compute Deuflhard's correction factors.
00197          */
00198         for (q=2; q <= LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX; ++q) {
00199             for (k=1; k < q; ++k) {
00200                 Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[k][q] = pow( eps1, (Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[k+1] - Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[q+1]) 
00201                 / ( (2.0*k+1.0)*(Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[q+1] - Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[1] + 1.0)) );
00202             }
00203         }
00204 
00205         /*
00206          *  Compute optimal row for convergence.
00207          */
00208         for (Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt=2; Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt < LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX; Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt++) 
00209             if (Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt+1] > Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt-1][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt] * Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt]) break;
00210             Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax = Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt;
00211 
00212     }
00213 
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217     H = Htry;
00218     u_save = *u;
00219     if ( (*s != Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew) || (H != *Hnext) || ( *reset ) ) {
00220         Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew = 0.0;
00221         *s   = 0.0;
00222         Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt = Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax;
00223         Info->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough = TRUE;
00224     }
00225     reduction = FALSE;
00226     done      = FALSE;
00227 
00228 
00229     while ( !done ) {
00230 
00231         for (k=1; k<=Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax; ++k) {
00232 
00233             Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew = *s + H;
00234             if (Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew == (*s)) { 
00235                 printf("H = %g\n", H);
00236                 fprintf(stderr, "step size underflow\n");
00237                 fprintf(stderr, "Htry, Hdid, Hnext = %g %g %g\n", Htry, *Hdid, *Hnext);
00238                 Info->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough=TRUE;
00239                 Info->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old = -1.0;
00240 printf("HOW DID I GET HERE?\n");
00241 exit(0);
00242                 return(-1);
00243             }
00244 
00245             n  = Seq[k];
00246             n2 = (double)(n*n);
00247             h2 = H*H;
00248             Lgm_ModMid( &u_save, &v, H, n, sgn, Mag, Info );
00249             sss = h2/n2;
00250             Lgm_RatFunExt( k-1, sss, &v, u, &uerr, Info );
00251             
00252             if (k !=  1){
00253 
00254                 e.x = fabs( uerr.x/u_scale->x );
00255                 e.y = fabs( uerr.y/u_scale->y );
00256                 e.z = fabs( uerr.z/u_scale->z );
00257                 max_error = 1.0e-30;
00258                 if (e.x > max_error) max_error = e.x;
00259                 if (e.y > max_error) max_error = e.y;
00260                 if (e.z > max_error) max_error = e.z;
00261                 max_error /= eps;
00262                 km = k-1;
00263                 err[km] = pow( max_error/LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE1, 1.0/(2.0*km + 1.0) );
00264             }
00265 
00266 
00267             if ( (k != 1) && ((k >= Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt-1) || Info->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough )) {
00268 
00269                 if ( max_error < 1.0 ) {
00270 
00271                     /*
00272                      *  We've converged! Bailout and go home...
00273                      */
00274                     done = TRUE;
00275 
00276                 } else if ( (k == Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax)||(k == Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt+1) ) {
00277 
00278                     red = LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE2/err[km];
00279 
00280                 } else if ( (k == Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt) && (Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt-1][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt] < err[km]) ) {
00281 
00282                     red = 1.0/err[km];
00283 
00284                 } else if ( (k == Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax) && (Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[km][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax-1] < err[km]) ) {
00285 
00286                     red = LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE2 * Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[km][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax-1]/err[km];
00287 
00288                 } else if ( Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[km][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt] < err[km] ) {
00289 
00290                     red = Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[km][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt-1]/err[km];
00291 
00292                 }
00293 
00294             }
00295 
00296 
00297         }
00298 
00299         if (!done) {
00300             red = (red < LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMIN) ? red : LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMIN;
00301             red = (red > LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMIN) ? red : LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMIN;
00302             H *= red;
00303             reduction = TRUE;
00304         }
00305 
00306     }
00307 
00308     *s     = Info->Lgm_MagStep_snew;
00309     *Hdid  = H;
00310     *reset = FALSE;
00311     Info->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough = FALSE;
00312     workmin = 1e99;
00313     for (kk=1; kk<=km; ++kk) {
00314         fact = (err[kk] > LGM_MAGSTEP_SCLMAX) ? err[kk] : LGM_MAGSTEP_SCLMAX;
00315 
00316         work = fact*Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[kk+1];
00317         if (work < workmin){
00318             scale   = fact;
00319             workmin = work;
00320             Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt    = kk+1;
00321         }
00322 
00323     }
00324 
00325     *Hnext = H/scale;
00326     if ( (Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt >= k) && (Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt != Info->Lgm_MagStep_kmax) && !reduction ) {
00327         f = scale/Info->Lgm_MagStep_alpha[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt-1][Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt];
00328         fact = (f > LGM_MAGSTEP_SCLMAX) ? f : LGM_MAGSTEP_SCLMAX;
00329         if ( Info->Lgm_MagStep_A[Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt+1]*fact <= workmin){
00330             *Hnext = H/fact;
00331             Info->Lgm_MagStep_kopt++;
00332         }
00333     }
00334 
00335 
00336 
00337     return(1);
00338 
00339 }
